articles.headline: Why Ron DeSantis Is Taking Aim at the Federal Reserve
articles.snippet: Florida’s governor has been blasting Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, while spreading misinformation about central bank digital currency.
articles.abstract: Florida’s governor has been blasting Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, while spreading misinformation about central bank digital currency.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida, who is preparing to take a widely anticipated leap into a 2024 presidential campaign, appears to have discovered something that populists throughout history have found to be true: Bashing the Federal Reserve is good politics.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Linda Qiu

articles.headline: An Online Meme Group Is at the Center of Uproar Over Leaked Military Secrets
articles.snippet: Youth culture and national defense collided in a community known for edgy jokes. The YouTube celebrity it was dedicated to seemed as surprised as anyone.
articles.abstract: Youth culture and national defense collided in a community known for edgy jokes. The YouTube celebrity it was dedicated to seemed as surprised as anyone.
articles.lead_paragraph: An online community of a few thousand subscribers that followed a YouTube celebrity named wow_mao had for years occupied a small, very male-centric corner of the internet. It was hosted on Discord, a social media app, where young people who were fans of wow_mao swapped humorous digital images and told edgy, sometimes tasteless, jokes.
articles.byline: By Kellen Browning and Stuart A. Thompson

articles.headline: From Red Carpet to Doghouse: Macron Returns From China to Allied Dismay
articles.snippet: Criticism of the French president’s performance in Beijing has been scathing among some allies, who saw him as cozying up to Beijing.
articles.abstract: Criticism of the French president’s performance in Beijing has been scathing among some allies, who saw him as cozying up to Beijing.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — President Emmanuel Macron landed in China to a red-carpet reception and all the pomp of a state visit, a three-day tour little short of a love-fest that he clearly hoped would further his ambitions for France to sit at the table of the great powers in a world changed by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and Beijing’s emergence as an arbiter of global conflict.

articles.headline: Mass Layoffs and Absentee Bosses Create a Morale Crisis at Meta
articles.snippet: Workers at Facebook’s parent have been increasingly alarmed by job cuts and the company’s direction.
articles.abstract: Workers at Facebook’s parent have been increasingly alarmed by job cuts and the company’s direction.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Raise your hand if you know who is getting fired?” a Meta employee wrote in an online chat group for the company’s engineers this month. “Fire emoji if you think it’s a dumpster fire.”
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Inflation Cools Notably, but It’s a Long Road Back to Normal
articles.snippet: Fed officials are debating how to set policy after bank blowups. Fresh inflation data are unlikely to make such decisions easier.
articles.abstract: Fed officials are debating how to set policy after bank blowups. Fresh inflation data are unlikely to make such decisions easier.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Inflation moderated notably in March as a decline in gas prices helped to pave the way for the slowest pickup in prices in nearly two years, providing relief for many American consumers and some evidence that the Federal Reserve’s campaign to raise interest rates and cool the economy is beginning to work.

articles.headline: As U.S. Tries to Isolate China, German Companies Move Closer
articles.snippet: Some are expanding in China, reluctant to leave a huge market they need to finance operations back home.
articles.abstract: Some are expanding in China, reluctant to leave a huge market they need to finance operations back home.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Washington seeks to throttle economic ties with Beijing, two powerful engines of the German economy, Volkswagen and the chemical company BASF, are broadening their huge Chinese investments.

articles.headline: What Good Are Wearable Computers if the Data Is Wrong?
articles.snippet: An Apple Watch or a Garmin can draw incorrect conclusions about your health, but the broad trends may be more valuable than the numbers.
articles.abstract: An Apple Watch or a Garmin can draw incorrect conclusions about your health, but the broad trends may be more valuable than the numbers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Smartwatches from tech companies like Apple and Garmin make it easy to see a number that could reflect how old you are more accurately than your age: the VO2max, the maximum amount of oxygen that your body can use during intense exercise.

articles.headline: Gourmet Dog Food Has Pet Owners Sending Kibbles Back
articles.snippet: Dog ownership surged during the pandemic. So did the options for fresh, human-grade dog food, an expanding market.
articles.abstract: Dog ownership surged during the pandemic. So did the options for fresh, human-grade dog food, an expanding market.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like so many 2-year-olds, Bear is a picky eater.

articles.headline: Why China Could Dominate the Next Big Advance in Batteries
articles.snippet: China is far ahead of the rest of the world in the development of batteries that use sodium, which are starting to compete with ubiquitous lithium power cells.
articles.abstract: China is far ahead of the rest of the world in the development of batteries that use sodium, which are starting to compete with ubiquitous lithium power cells.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Changsha, deep in China’s interior, thousands of chemists, engineers and manufacturing workers are shaping the future of batteries.

articles.headline: A Plan to Ban TikTok in Montana Is a Preview for the Rest of the Country
articles.snippet: The fight has shown the difficult test and legally perilous road facing lawmakers or the White House if they try to enact a national ban on the social media service.
articles.abstract: The fight has shown the difficult test and legally perilous road facing lawmakers or the White House if they try to enact a national ban on the social media service.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers in Washington are pushing for an outright ban of TikTok on American soil. Montana might beat them to it.
